title: How would one go about becoming a second grade teacher? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’ll add a word of caution. You can easily find out online what the requirements are for the certification you’re looking for in the state(s) where you want to teach. Google TEACHER CERTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS IN [NAME OF STATE]. In many states you can earn a certificate that allows you to teach K-5. The likelihood that you’ll always be assigned to a second grade class is slim. The principal may need a fourth grade teacher, and that’s where you’ll go. The following year it may be second grade, and two years later it’s third grade. Superintendents and principals like flexibility. If you want a job, you won’t say that you’re limited to one grade. In my state, subject matter teachers are licensed K-12 in their subject, and are sometimes a little surprised to learn that after ten years in the high school, they’re really needed in the elementary school. They adapt.

As I have a Bachelors in Education and a Master’s in Psychology/therapy, I would go for credentialing for elementary school. Find a college near you that offers the required classes. If you have not yet been to or graduated from a college or university find one close to you that offers courses in teacher education, specializing in early elementary education. You should have at least a Bachelor’s level degree to work with/ become an elementary teacher. This is a rewarding and often fun age to teach as they are still young enough to be excited about learning and old enough to do fun projects in class. Hope you explore this.
